result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven R West was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Steven R West in court, in custody with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases called 14CM432, 14CF554, 15CM155, 15CF501, & 15CF187. Restitution stipulation and victim impact statement filed.  RIghts/Elements.  14CF554 Defendant pled no contest to Ct. 4.  15CF501 no contest to Cts. 2 & 4, 15CF187 no contest Ct. 1.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  All other counts dismissed but read in for all cases called.  14CM432  dismissed but read in for restitution, 15CM155 dismissed but read in.  In 14CF554 Court sentenced defendant on Ct. 4 to pay $268.00 costs.  15CF187 Court sentenced defendant on Ct. 1 to pay $268.00 costs. 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts.  15CF501 Court sentenced defendant on Ct. 2 to serve 5 years in prison.  2 years initial confinement and 3 years extended supervision.  Conditions of extended supervision includes: $5521.98 restitution, this includes the surcharge.  No contact with K.R. and K.H.  AODA and comply.  Submit DNA sample.  Maintain absolute sobriety this includes drugs.  $518.00 fines/costs.  Defendant is eligible for challenge incarceration and substance abuse programs.  Ct. 4 $243.00 fines/costs. 60 days to pay on Ct. 4 or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts.  Prison starts forthwith.  114 days jail credit.   9:53/10:21
